description: Borrowed from Middle French codicille, from Latin cōdicillus, diminutive of cōdex. See code.

entries.meaning: (law) An addition or supplement that explains, modifies, or revokes a will or part of one.
An addition or supplement modifying any official document, such as a treaty.

verbs.description: codicil (third-person singular simple present codicils, present participle codiciling or codicilling, simple past and past participle codiciled or codicilled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To add a codicil to something.
